content:
Foxy Review | Bon Appetit









































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginmontrealFoxyA perennially packed wood-fired hangout in GriffintownFacebookPinterestTwitterEmailPhoto by Dominique LafondGO HERE: for Foxy’s signature smoke-redolent meat dishes, cooked over the kitchen’s charcoal grill or roasted in its wood-fired oven.ORDER THE: fluffy flatbread topped with sweet Bianco DiNapoli tomatoes and guanciale; hanger steak that playfully comes with ranch dressing; and any of the charred seasonal vegetables you see.THE VIBE IS: sleek and modern, with lots of gray tones, rows of graphic, glowing lights, and some cheek, like fox figurines above the bar.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day 5:30 to 11 p.m. Reservations through OpenTable are recommended, as the place fills up most evenings.—Claire SaffitzPhoto by Dominique LafondPhoto by Dominique LafondWE ALSO LOVENora GrayThe standout Italian restaurant in GriffintownOlive + GourmandoCarb up at this charming Old Montreal brunch standbyDamasAll the meze (and fresh pita!) at this standout Syrian spot in OutremontExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
